newsitem.title: SENEGAL: France Telecom to get Senegal Telecom stake-paper.
newsitem.headline: France Telecom to get Senegal Telecom stake-paper.

text.p: Senegal will sell one third of state telecommunications company SONATEL to France Cables Radio, a subsidiary of France Telecom, on Monday, Senegal's official Le Soleil daily reported on Saturday.
"A 33.33 percent stake plus one share will be given to France Cables Radio," the paper said, quoting unamed sources at the Ministry of Economy and Finance.
The agreement will be signed on Monday in Dakar with the new partner, which is a 100-percent-owned subsidiary of France Telecom, the paper said.

The state will keep a stake of around a third, 10 percent will go to SONATEL staff and five percent to an unnamed African partner, Le Soleil said. The remaining shares could be sold to other institutions and the public.

France Telecom started talks for the purchase of a one-third stake in SONATEL after the cancellation on April 16 by Senegal of a provisional deal worth 70 billion CFA francs ($116 million) with a consortium led by Swedish company Telia TELI.CN Overseas.
The Swedish consortium wanted a seven-year concession which would have lasted only until the proposed end of SONATEL'S monopoly over the fixed-line network.
Le Soleil said France Cables Radio had put on the table an offer "not far from the 70 billion CFA francs which Telia had proposed".
During the original round of bidding, France Telecom had made the second best offer of 65 billion CFA francs. ($ = 605 CFA francs)
